firstTimeSetup.title: How to set up CIVICycle for the first time
firstTimeSetup.summary: Before you start using CIVICycle, an Admin user needs to configure materials, locations, and pricing. This is a one-time setup.
firstTimeSetup.steps:
Log in with your Admin account (default: admin@greenrecycle.org / password from setup).
Go to Admin Panel in the left sidebar.
Click the Materials tab. Click 'Add Material' for each recyclable type you handle (e.g. Cardboard, PET Plastic, Aluminum). Enter the name, description, and unit (kg).
Click the Locations tab. Click 'Add Location' for each recycling station. Enter the name, address, and manager name.
Click the Pricing tab. Click 'Set Daily Prices'. For each material, enter the Purchase Price/kg (what you pay vendors) and Sale Price/kg (what you charge clients). Click 'Save All Prices'.
Go to Vendors in the left sidebar. Click 'Add Waste Picker' for each vendor you buy from. Enter their name, phone, and payment preference.
Go to Clients in the left sidebar. Click 'Add Client' for each company you sell to. Enter the company name and contact info.
Optional: Go to Sources to add apartment complexes. Click 'Add Source', enter the name and address, then click on it and use 'Add Unit' or 'Bulk Add Units' to add apartments.
firstTimeSetup.notes:
You only need to do this once. After setup, daily operations just need price updates.
Admin and Manager roles can access Admin Panel. Operators and Viewers cannot.
You can always add more materials, locations, vendors, and clients later.

dailyPricing.title: How to set daily prices
dailyPricing.summary: Prices should be updated each morning before recording transactions. This ensures the correct price auto-fills when you create purchases or sales.
dailyPricing.steps:
Go to Admin Panel in the left sidebar.
Click the Pricing tab.
Click 'Set Daily Prices' (the blue button).
A form appears showing all your materials. The prices are pre-filled with yesterday's prices.
Edit the Purchase Price/kg and Sale Price/kg for any materials whose prices changed today.
Leave the time set to 'All Day' unless you have different morning and afternoon rates.
Click 'Save All Prices' at the bottom.
A green confirmation appears showing how many prices were saved.
dailyPricing.notes:
If you skip this step, transactions will still work but the price field will be empty and you will need to type the price manually.
To set different morning/afternoon rates: uncheck 'All Day', set a start time and end time, save, then add another price entry for the other time window.
Old prices are never deleted. To see past prices, check 'Show expired prices' and filter by date.

recordPurchase.title: How to record a material purchase
recordPurchase.summary: When a waste picker (vendor) brings materials to your station, record the purchase here. This adds the material to your inventory and tracks what you owe the vendor.
recordPurchase.steps:
Go to Transactions in the left sidebar.
Click 'New Purchase' (the green button at the top right).
Select the Location (which recycling station received the material).
Select the Material (e.g. Cardboard, PET Plastic). The Unit Price automatically fills from today's daily price.
Select the Waste Picker (vendor) who brought the material.
Enter the Weight in kg.
Select the Quality Grade: Premium, Standard, or Low.
Optional: Under 'Source Origin', select the apartment complex and unit where the material came from. This is useful for traceability.
Select the Payment Method (Cash, Bank Transfer, or Mobile Money).
Set the Payment Status: Paid (if you paid now), Pending (if you will pay later), or Partial (if partially paid).
If partially paid, enter the paid amount.
Click 'Save Transaction'.
recordPurchase.notes:
The inventory at the selected location automatically increases by the weight you entered.
If the price field is empty, go to Admin Panel > Pricing and set today's prices first.
If you are offline (no internet), the transaction saves locally and syncs automatically when you reconnect.

sellMaterials.title: How to create a sale
sellMaterials.summary: When you sell collected materials to a client, record the sale here. This deducts the material from your inventory and tracks what the client owes you.
sellMaterials.steps:
Go to Transactions in the left sidebar and click the 'Sales' tab at the top.
Click 'New Sale'.
Select the Client (the company buying from you).
Select the Location (which station the material is shipped from).
Select the Material type. The Unit Price auto-fills from today's sale price.
Enter the Weight in kg.
Select the Payment Method and Payment Status.
Add any Notes if needed.
Click 'Create Sale'.
If the system warns that stock is insufficient, you can choose to continue anyway or cancel and check your inventory first.
sellMaterials.notes:
The inventory at the selected location automatically decreases by the weight you entered.
If stock is lower than the sale amount, a yellow warning appears. You can still proceed.
To void a sale (if it was entered by mistake): find it in the sales list, click on it, and choose 'Void Sale'. This reverses the stock deduction.

deliverSale.title: How to record a delivery
deliverSale.summary: After creating a sale, you can record the delivery details: who drove the truck, which vehicle was used, and when it was delivered.
deliverSale.steps:
Go to Transactions > Sales tab.
Find the sale in the list and click on it to expand it.
Click 'Mark as Delivered'.
Select the Delivery Status: 'In Transit' (on the way), 'Delivered' (completed), or 'Partial' (only part delivered).
Enter the Vehicle Type (e.g. Truck, Van, Pickup).
Enter the Registration Number (license plate).
Enter the Driver's Full Name.
Enter the Driver's ID Card Number.
Add any Delivery Notes (optional).
Click Save.
deliverSale.notes:
You can update delivery details later (e.g. change from 'In Transit' to 'Delivered' once it arrives).
The driver and vehicle info creates a chain of custody record for auditing.
To send automatic delivery confirmation emails to clients, enable it in Admin Panel > Confirmations.

trackPayments.title: How to track and update payments
trackPayments.summary: Track what you owe vendors (purchases) and what clients owe you (sales). Mark transactions as paid when payment is completed.
trackPayments.steps:
For purchase payments: Go to Transactions. Use the filter dropdown to show only 'Pending' payment status.
Find the transaction you want to update.
Click on it to expand it, then click 'Mark as Paid'.
For sale payments: Go to Transactions > Sales tab. Filter by 'Pending' payment status.
Find the sale and click 'Mark as Paid'.
To see a summary of all outstanding payments: Go to Reports, select the 'Overview' tab, and check the 'Pending Payments' card. Or go to the Purchases tab and look at the 'Outstanding' column.
trackPayments.notes:
You can also mark payments as 'Partial' if only part of the amount was paid.
The Dashboard always shows the total Pending Payments amount on the top card.
Use the Reports > Purchases > By Vendor view to see how much you owe each vendor.

generateReport.title: How to generate and export a report
generateReport.summary: Generate reports to see your business performance, then download them as PDF, CSV, or Excel, or email them directly.
generateReport.steps:
Go to Reports in the left sidebar.
Choose a report tab: Overview (summary), Purchases (what you bought), Sales (what you sold), Traceability (material flow), or Analysis (custom grouping).
Set the Start Date and End Date for the period you want to analyze.
For the Purchases tab: choose 'By Vendor', 'By Material', or 'Detailed' to change how data is grouped.
For the Sales tab: choose 'By Client', 'By Material', or 'Detailed'.
For the Analysis tab: use the 'Group by' dropdown to group by Vendor, Source, Unit, Material, Location, or Client.
To download: Click 'Export Report', then choose PDF, CSV, or Excel.
To email: Click 'Email Report', enter the recipient's email, choose the format, and click Send.
generateReport.notes:
PDF exports are formatted nicely and best for sharing with people.
CSV and Excel exports contain raw data for further analysis in spreadsheets.
Emailing reports requires SMTP to be configured in Admin Panel > Email Settings.
Scheduled automatic reports can be set up in Admin Panel > Scheduling.

traceOrigin.title: How to trace where materials came from
traceOrigin.summary: Use Traceability to find out which apartment, which vendor, and which transactions are connected to specific materials.
traceOrigin.steps:
Go to Traceability in the left sidebar (under the CRM section).
Click 'Show Filters' if the filters are not visible.
Select a Source apartment complex from the dropdown to see all materials collected from there.
Optional: Select a specific Unit to narrow down to one apartment.
Optional: Select a specific Waste Picker to see only their transactions.
Optional: Select a Material type.
Set a date range.
The results show a Summary table with totals by source and material.
Click the arrow next to any row to expand it and see every individual transaction.
traceOrigin.notes:
For traceability to work, you must select the Source Origin when recording purchases (step 8 in 'How to record a purchase').
If no results appear, check that the date range covers the period when purchases were made.
This feature is available to Admin and Manager roles.

manageVendors.title: How to add or edit a vendor (waste picker)
manageVendors.summary: Vendors are the waste pickers who sell materials to you. You need to add them before you can record purchases from them.
manageVendors.steps:
Go to Vendors in the left sidebar (under CRM).
To add: Click 'Add Waste Picker'. Fill in the first name, last name, phone number, and email. Select a payment method (Cash, Bank Transfer, or Mobile Money). If Bank Transfer, enter the bank name and account number. Toggle 'Affiliated' if they are part of your cooperative. Click Save.
To edit: Find the vendor in the list (use the search bar to search by name, ID, phone, or email). Click the pencil icon on their row. Make changes and click Save.
To delete: Click the trash icon on their row and confirm.
manageVendors.notes:
Government ID numbers are encrypted in the database for security.
The vendor's payment preference auto-fills when you create a purchase transaction for them.

manageClients.title: How to add or edit a client (buyer)
manageClients.summary: Clients are the companies or people who buy your recycled materials. You need to add them before you can create sales.
manageClients.steps:
Go to Clients in the left sidebar (under CRM).
To add: Click 'Add Client'. Enter the company name, contact person, phone, email, address, and payment terms. Click Save.
To edit: Find the client in the list. Click the pencil icon. Make changes and click Save.
To deactivate: Click the deactivate button. Deactivated clients will not appear in the sales form but their history is preserved.
manageClients.notes:
Only active clients appear in the dropdown when creating a new sale.
Deactivating is better than deleting because it preserves the sales history.

manageSources.title: How to add apartment complexes and units
manageSources.summary: Sources are the apartment complexes or buildings where recyclable materials come from. Adding them enables traceability.
manageSources.steps:
Go to Sources in the left sidebar (under CRM).
Click 'Add Source'. Enter the apartment complex name, address, and contact info. Click Save.
Click on the source name to open its detail page.
To add units one by one: Click 'Add Unit'. Enter the unit number, floor, resident name, and phone. Click Save.
To add many units at once: Click 'Bulk Add Units'. Enter a range like 101-120 to create 20 units automatically.
Now when recording purchases, you can select this source and specific unit in the 'Source Origin' section.
manageSources.notes:
Each unit can have a resident name and phone for contact purposes.
The source detail page shows how many transactions and total weight collected from this location.
Bulk add is the fastest way to set up a new complex.

manageUsers.title: How to add or manage user accounts
manageUsers.summary: Create accounts for your team members. Each person should have their own login. Only Admin users can manage accounts.
manageUsers.steps:
Go to Admin Panel in the left sidebar.
Look for the Users section or User Management.
To add: Click 'Add User'. Enter first name, last name, email (this is their login username), and a password (minimum 6 characters). Select their role: Admin (full access), Manager (most features), Operator (purchases and sales), or Viewer (read-only). Click Save.
To edit: Click the pencil icon on a user's row. Change any fields. Leave password blank to keep their current password. Click Save.
To delete: Click the trash icon and confirm.
manageUsers.notes:
Only Admin users can see and access User Management.
Operators can record transactions and sales but cannot change settings or manage users.
Viewers can see reports and data but cannot create or modify anything.
Each email address must be unique across all users.

changePassword.title: How to change your password or edit your profile
changePassword.summary: Any user can change their own password and update their name or email from the profile menu.
changePassword.steps:
Click on your name in the top-right corner of the screen.
To view your profile: Click 'View Profile'. This shows your name, email, role, and when you last logged in.
To edit your name or email: In the profile view, click 'Edit'. Make your changes and click 'Save'.
To change your password: Click 'Change Password' from the dropdown menu. Enter your current password, then type your new password twice. Click Save.
changePassword.notes:
Your new password takes effect immediately. Use it the next time you log in.
Passwords must be at least 6 characters.
Your role can only be changed by an Admin user - you cannot change it yourself.

useOffline.title: How to use CIVICycle without internet
useOffline.summary: CIVICycle works offline. You can record purchases even with no internet connection, and they sync automatically when you reconnect.
useOffline.steps:
Check the connection icon in the top bar: green = online, red = offline.
While offline, go to Transactions and create purchases as normal. They save to your device.
When your internet comes back, the app detects the connection automatically.
Pending transactions sync to the server automatically. You will see a success notification.
If sync does not start automatically, click the sync button (circular arrows icon) in the top bar.
useOffline.notes:
Only purchase transactions work offline. Sales, reports, and admin features need internet.
Offline data is stored in your browser. Do not clear your browser data or you will lose unsynced transactions.
For the best offline experience, install CIVICycle as an app: click the install prompt in your browser (Chrome/Edge).

switchLanguage.title: How to change language or date format
switchLanguage.summary: Switch between English and Spanish instantly. Change date and time display formats for the whole system.
switchLanguage.steps:
To switch language: Click the globe button in the top bar (shows 'EN' or 'ES'). The entire interface changes immediately.
To change date format: Go to Admin Panel > Display Settings. Select DD/MM/YYYY, MM/DD/YYYY, or YYYY-MM-DD.
To change time format: In the same Display Settings page, select 12-hour (AM/PM) or 24-hour.
Date and time settings apply to everyone and all exported reports.
switchLanguage.notes:
Language preference is saved in your browser and remembered next time you visit.
Date and time format changes are global - they affect all users and exported reports.
